{"step_by_step_thinking": "A cleft palate is a condition where the roof of the mouth contains an opening into the nose. A prosthetic appliance used to cover this defect is called an obturator. An artificial velum is not the correct term, and while an obturator is a type of removable prosthetic appliance, the specific term for the appliance used in cleft palate cases is obturator.", "answer_choice": "B. Obturator"}
